com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling

Class ExternallyIndexedJournalingPersistentStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling.JournalingPersistentStoreBase
      • com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling.ExternallyIndexedJournalingPersistentStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IByteArrayStore, IVersionedSizedStore, IPersistentByteArrayStore, IJournalingStoreAccessor, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class ExternallyIndexedJournalingPersistentStore
extends JournalingPersistentStoreBase
    Journaling persistent store implementation combining a journal and an external indexer. The store itself does not enforce any collection semantics, the actual management of the data structure being under the responsibility of the indexer.

    When writing to this store, write requests are not expected to contain a key or an index, but only a type, a value and a version. Upon successfully writing to the store, the write request's offset is then set to the offset in the underlying journal at which it was written, thus allowing the store's indexer to make use of it to index contents.
    When reading from the store, read requests are expected to only contain an offset.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExternallyIndexedJournalingPersistentStore

        public ExternallyIndexedJournalingPersistentStore(File directory,
                                                  Properties properties,
                                                  JournalingPersistentStoreIndexer indexer)
        Constructor. Creates a new on-disk store, or loads an existing one.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory containing the store's files
        properties - configuration properties refining the store's behaviour
        indexer - the store's external indexer
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either of the following occurs:
        • directory does not have a parent
        • directory's parent does not exist
        • directory's parent is not a directory
        PersistenceIOException - reports any I/O error that may occur when interacting with the file-system
        MissingJournalFileException - if a journal file appears to be missing when trying to load the journal from disk
        PersistenceConfigurationException - if an invalid configuration property is encountered

      • keys

        public void keys(IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: IByteArrayStore
        Iterates through the keys in the store.
        Parameters:
        handler - iteration handler. Method IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler.key(BytesSegment) in this handler is called in turn for each key in the store. The iteration can be stopped at any time by having method IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler.key(BytesSegment) return false.
